definition: to have a falling out/to have a big argument
noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke
to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross
to create a big disturbance

sentences.english: One day, mom was not at home.
sentences.chinese: 媽媽不在家，孩子們鬧翻天。

sentences.english: On the night of June 1, all hell broke loose.
Did you hear the carryings-on next door last night ?
sentences.chinese: 你聽見沒聽見昨晚隔壁鬧翻天了？

sentences.english: He'll raise hell if we don't finish on time.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們不按時完工的話，他會鬧翻天的。

sentences.english: Then might mess up, first was the daughter goes home "to raise a rumpus ".
sentences.chinese: 這下可亂套了，首先是女兒回家“鬧翻了天”。

sentences.english: For a start, by the end of the week the children are imploding.
sentences.chinese: 開始時，孩子們在週末把家裏鬧翻了天。

sentences.english: All hell broke out around here when your column appeared.
sentences.chinese: 你的專欄文章一發表，我們這裏就鬧翻了天。

sentences.english: But we broke up a year ago. He hasn't spoken to me since then.
sentences.chinese: 但是一年前鬧翻了，從此他再也沒有理過我。

sentences.english: But the two men fell out in 1455, and Fust sued Gutenberg.
sentences.chinese: 但兩人於1455年鬧翻，福斯特控告了古滕伯格。

sentences.english: They split up, spread out, sunned themselves, bickered.
sentences.chinese: 他們鬧翻，舒展身軀曬太陽，他們鬥嘴。

sentences.english: Amazingly, just about everyone he works with falls out with him.
sentences.chinese: 讓人喫驚的是跟他工作過的所有人都跟他鬧翻了。

sentences.english: She is out with her husband.
He fell out with his father and became a wanderer .
sentences.chinese: 他和父親鬧翻了，成了一名遊子。

sentences.english: The party went a whole night, it seemed as the house wound be raised the roof.
sentences.chinese: 派對進行了整個晚上，似乎把房子都要鬧翻天。

sentences.english: The couple recently had a falling-out over where they should go on their vacation.
sentences.chinese: 那對夫妻最近爲了究竟該去哪裏渡假而鬧翻了。

sentences.english: Mr Yamadayev had fallen out with Chechnya's president, Ramzan Kadyrov.
sentences.chinese: 此前亞瑪迪耶夫已經與車臣總統卡德羅夫鬧翻。

definition: to rupture/to burst open/to break/to break off relations with/a rupture
to break off relations/to break with sb
to have an acrimonious falling-out/to shed all pretense of cordiality/to tear into each other
to question intensely/to interrogate/to demand information
lit. to take different roads and urge the horses on (idiom)/fig. to part ways
to act in a fit of pique/to get in a huff/to be peeved
to lay one's cards on the table
to part on bad terms/(of a meeting etc) to break up in discord
stuck together as by glue (of lovers)/joined at the hip
to vanish/to disappear from the face of the earth
to disagree/dissent
(coll.) to pester/to harass
to lament/to complain tearfully/to wail accusingly
lit. lotus roots may break, but the fiber remains joined (idiom); lovers part, but still long for one another
to expel (a member of an organization)/to fire (an employee)
to match one's strength with/to compete/more competitive/to set oneself against sb/disobliging/to make a special effort
